PIONEER DIET: WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN PIONEERS EAT?

Instructions: Please answer as many of these questions as you can and mail it to the Saskatoon Archives Office. Information from these questionnaires will be preserved as part of the permanent records of the province.

Name: Emma C. Wilde
Address: 106 Wilde, Emma C., Foam Lake, Sask.
Birthplace: Ontario

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS
What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1902
Where did you set up housekeeping? Foam Lake, Sask.
Where had you been living before that? Foam Lake
For how many people did you prepare meals? 6-8 members
How far was it to your nearest store? 5 miles
How often could a visit be made to the store? Twice a month
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years? Flour, tea & sugar

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS
What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Puritan
In what quantities did you buy it? 50 lbs
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $1.68
How much did you use graham flour?
Whole wheat flour?
Was flour milled locally? Yes
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats?
What other grain products did you use?
Cornmeal? Yes
Other?
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? No
How did you grind it?
